content: ribbing shorter but i think longer ribbing fits this pattern best round 23 knit all sts change color to pink/green purl details color round 24 knit all sts round 25-26 purl all sts continue to the leg leg change color to purple main color work rounds 1-6 of the main pattern* 11 times or to desired length main pattern for the leg chart for the main pattern is on the right side of this page repeat what s in green brackets until there s 1 st left then work according to the 4th column written pattern round 1 3 5 knit all sts round 2 4 *sl 1 k3* repeat what s in * * until there s 1 st left k1 round 6 *sl 1 p3* repeat what s in * * until there s 1 st left p1 work main pattern on the front of the foot* 33 sts and take note of the next round of the chart to be worked continue to the heel *main pattern for the front of the foot if you re working from the chart you should repeat what s in green brackets until there s 1 st left then work according to the 1st column written pattern for the front of the foot round 1 3 5 knit all sts round 2 4 *sl 1 k3* repeat what s in * * until there s 1 st left sl 1 round 6 *sl 1 p3* repeat what s in * * until there s 1 st left sl 1 heel work the heel across the back 32 sts i like the no-wrap short row heel by stone knits with a small gusset added but feel free to substitute it for your favorite heel short row or heel flap keep in mind that short row heels generally don t work very well for people with high insteps foot work the next round of the main pattern across the first 33 sts pm k to bor note bor and the marker divides our sock in two sections - front first 33 sts and back last 32 sts continue to work the main pattern across the first 33 sts sm k to bor stop when your sock foot measures 6cm/2 4 shorter than desired length when tried on this should be roughly at the beginning of your pinky toe you should end with round 4 of the pattern continue to the toe @crochetedbybogusia - follow me on instagram so much fun stuff instructions toe change color to pink/green purl details color round 1 knit all sts round 2 purl to 2 sts before the marker p2tog sm knit to bor 1 st decrease d 64 sts overall round 3 purl to marker sm knit to bor change color to yellow/blue ribbing color round 4 *k2 ssk knit to 4 sts before the marker k2tog k2* sm repeat from * once more - bor acts as 2nd marker 4 sts decrease d 60 sts overall
